message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the properties of butter and the effect of heat on substances. When butter is dropped into boiling water, the heat causes it to melt and liquefy. Option (A) is incorrect because "hoover" is not a term associated with the behavior of butter in boiling water. Option (B) is incorrect because butter does not grow when dropped into boiling water. Option (D) is incorrect because the freezing point of water is lower than the boiling point, so the butter would not refreeze in boiling water.
